etymology.description: Combines 彳(彳) (chì, "step") + 止(止) (zhǐ, "stop") = movement and stopping -> walk
etymology.interpretation: The character 辵(辵) combines elements signifying movement, 彳(彳) (chì, "step"), and cessation of movement, 止(止) (zhǐ, "stop"), to visually convey the action of walking or progressing.

examples.chinese: 行走得很稳重时(行走得很穩重時)，他总是注意辵的象形结构(他總是注意辶的象形結構)。
examples.pinyin: xíngzǒu dé hěn wěnzhòng shí, tā zǒng shì zhùyì chuò de xiàngxíng jiégòu.
examples.english: When walking steadily, he always pays attention to the pictographic structure of '辵'.

examples.chinese: 他平时喜欢漫步时(他平時喜歡漫步時)，研究古字中的辵偏旁(研究古字中的辶偏旁)。
examples.pinyin: tā píngshí xǐhuān mànbù shí, yánjiū gǔ zì zhōng de chuò piānpáng.
examples.english: He likes to stroll in his spare time, and he studies the radical '辵' in ancient characters.
